She's in Portland is a 2020 American comedy drama film directed by Marc Carlini and written by Carlini and Patrick Alexander. It stars Tommy Dewey, François Arnaud and Minka Kelly.
She's in Portland had its world premiere at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival on January 16, 2020.[1] It was released on September 25, 2020, on digital and on demand.[2]


Plot[edit]
Two college friends, now in their thirties, admire each other's lives and feel trapped in their own. Wes, tied to a demanding career and responsibilities to family, extends a work trip to drag his dispirited artist friend Luke to find Luke's "one that got away".

Cast[edit]
Tommy Dewey as Wes
Paige Spara as Mallory
François Arnaud as Luke
Minka Kelly as Sarah Hill
Joelle Carter as Rebecca
Lola Glaudini as Ellen
Samba Schutte as Steve
Soundtrack[edit]
The score soundtrack album of the film was composed by Mondo Boys. It was released on October 9, 2020.[3]

Reception[edit]
Rotten Tomatoes gives the film a 67% approval rating based on 15 reviews, with an average rating of 6.2/10.[4]

References[edit]


^ Lauren Bray (January 16, 2020). "Film Review: She's in Portland". Edhat. Retrieved December 5, 2020.

^ N'Duka, Amanda (August 17, 2020). "Freestyle Digital Lands 'She's in Portland' Comedy With Tommy Dewey, Francois Arnaud & Minka Kelly". Deadline. Retrieved December 5, 2020.

^ "'She's in Portland' Soundtrack Released". Film Music Reporter. Retrieved December 5, 2020.

^ "She's in Portland (2020)". Rotten Tomatoes. Fandango. Retrieved October 30, 2021.
